text: What are strategies for identifying if shapes have been scaled (similar figures) or if the shapes are imposters?
Answers will vary. There are many possible solutions. Some possible answers:

• There is a scale factor for corresponding sides.
  • Equivalent ratios of adjacent side lengths in one shape and the corresponding ratio of adjacent side lengths of the other shape are equivalent.
  • One shape is a rep-tile of the other.
  • Corresponding angles are equal. This is not enough to determine similar figures. There must also be a relationship among corresponding lengths. This is mentioned above.
